divisions.division_name: Reproductive, Maternal, neonatal, Child, And Adolescent Health Related Schemes

schemes.objective: To address the health needs of adolescents in the age group of 10-19 years.
key_features: Focus on sexual and reproductive health, mental health, nutrition, substance misuse, and violence
Community-based interventions and peer education
Adolescent-friendly health clinics

schemes.objective: To provide comprehensive health care and early detection of diseases, deficiencies, developmental delays, and disabilities in children under 18 years.
key_features: Screening for 4 Ds: Defects at birth, Deficiencies, Diseases, Development delays including disabilities
Free treatment and management at public health facilities
Mobile health teams and health screening at schools and Anganwadi centers

schemes.objective: To prevent mortality and morbidity in children and pregnant women against vaccine-preventable diseases.
key_features: Provision of vaccines to children against diseases like Diphtheria, Pertussis, Tetanus, Polio, Measles, and Hepatitis B
Inclusion of new vaccines like Rotavirus, Pneumococcal, and Japanese Encephalitis

schemes.objective: To reduce maternal and neonatal mortality by promoting institutional deliveries.
key_features: Cash incentives for institutional deliveries
Focus on low-performing states and rural areas
Support by Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHAs) for antenatal and postnatal care

schemes.objective: To provide quality antenatal care to pregnant women on the 9th of every month.
key_features: Free antenatal check-ups and counseling at government health centers
Identification and management of high-risk pregnancies
Involvement of private sector doctors to volunteer for the program

schemes.objective: To train healthcare providers in the essential newborn care and resuscitation.
key_features: Focus on reducing neonatal mortality
Training on basic newborn care including resuscitation
Implementation in both public and private healthcare settings

schemes.scheme_name: LaQshya Programme (Labour Room Quality Improvement Initiative)
schemes.objective: To improve the quality of care in labour rooms and maternity operation theatres.
key_features: Focus on respectful maternity care
Implementation of standard operating procedures and clinical protocols
Capacity building and monitoring of labour room staff

schemes.scheme_name: National Programme for Prevention and Control of Fluorosis (NPPCF)
schemes.objective: To prevent and control fluorosis, a public health problem caused by excess fluoride in water.
key_features: Monitoring fluoride levels in drinking water
Public awareness and education on fluorosis prevention
Treatment of affected individuals

schemes.scheme_name: National Iron Plus Initiative for Anaemia Control
schemes.objective: To reduce the prevalence of anemia across all age groups.
key_features: Provision of iron and folic acid supplements
Deworming and screening for anemia
Nutrition counseling and promotion of iron-rich foods
schemes.target_group: Children, adolescents, pregnant women, and lactating mothers

programmes.objective: To detect and respond to disease outbreaks quickly.
key_features: Collection, analysis, and dissemination of disease surveillance data
Outbreak investigations and response activities
Capacity building of surveillance staff

programmes.objective: To achieve universal access to tuberculosis care and treatment.
key_features: Provision of free TB diagnosis and treatment services
Implementation of the DOTS (Directly Observed Treatment, Short-course) strategy
Active case finding and management

programmes.programme_name: National Vector Borne Disease Control Programme (NVBDCP)
programmes.objective: To prevent and control vector-borne diseases such as malaria, dengue, and chikungunya.
key_features: Surveillance and control of mosquito-borne diseases
Distribution of insecticide-treated nets and indoor residual spraying
Public awareness campaigns on vector control

programmes.objective: To eliminate leprosy as a public health problem in India.
key_features: Early detection and treatment of leprosy cases
Provision of multi-drug therapy (MDT) free of charge
Rehabilitation of leprosy-affected individuals

programmes.objective: To prevent the spread of HIV/AIDS and provide care and treatment to people living with HIV.
key_features: Awareness and education on HIV prevention
Provision of free antiretroviral therapy (ART)
Support services for people living with HIV/AIDS
programmes.target_group: General population, key populations at higher risk of HIV
